CFD160.title: CFD 160 Principles of Development in Early Childhood
CFD160.desc: Development of the child from conception through 8 years of age including weekly laboratory experience with preschool children.

CFD163.title: CFD 163 Relationships in Today's Families
CFD163.req: General Education Course (Focus on Social and Behavioral Sciences).
CFD163.desc: Personal and family living in the early stages of family life cycle. Concepts and methods used in initiating, building, maintaining and enriching relationships.

CFD197.title: CFD 197 Introductory Topics in Child and Family Development
CFD197.desc: Variable content course for introductory concepts in Child and Family Development. May be repeated to a total of 6 hours when topics change.

CFD250.title: CFD 250 Parenting in Contemporary Society
CFD250.desc: Explores parenting and child rearing in today's society.

CFD255.title: CFD 255 Principles of Development in Infancy
CFD255.desc: Child from conception through two years, including prenatal environment. Two hours laboratory experience weekly in infant-toddler child development laboratory.

CFD256.title: CFD 256 Supervised Experience in the Infant Toddler Center
CFD256.desc: Experience in applying effective techniques that optimize infant toddler development with 2-hours per week of participation in the infant toddler laboratory.

CFD257.title: CFD 257 Principles of Development in Middle Childhood
CFD257.desc: Development of the child from six through twelve years in cognitive, physical, social, emotional aspects. Contact with groups of children in this age range is arranged.
